result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquan D Lovett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs and surcharges. To be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11/12/15.  If not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Statements made as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, with credit for 151 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 8 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from 25% of prison wages or by 11.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Restitution Worksheet;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 1 dismissed and read-in to case.
AS TO COUNT 2:   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armour. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joe Domask for Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Shaquan D Lovett not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case still in trial posture.
Defendant's Witness List and Requested Jury Instructions.
State's Witness List and Motion in Limine.

Attorney Jessica Bellows in court, defendant Shaquan D Lovett not in court, in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 6.17.15 and for jury trial on 7.13.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.

Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Defendant Shaquan D Lovett in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Arthur S., Angel M., and Rashada F.
